poem:
Title: Ode to the Ken Collective

In Hollywood's marquee, Ken's the cognomen,
A symphony of plastic face, outshone only by Gosling's grace.
Pastel pink Oscars' cinnamon swirl,
Sixty-five Kens and a Barbie girl.
A larger audience they yearn,
To tradition's moorings, they return.
The Dolby's echo whispers, 'when?', 
All we answer - "Here's to Ken".
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Oscars 2024 aiming for a bigger audience, but that may be beyond Ken On Sunday night in Los Angeles at the Dolby theatre one name from Hollywood’s recent past will ring out louder than any other: not Cillian or Emma but Ken. There will be 65 of them to be precise, joining Ryan Gosling on stage as he performs I’m Just a Ken from Barbie whose cast has been all over the Oscars’ pastel pink". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Oscars 2024 aiming for a bigger audience, but that may be beyond Ken On Sunday night in Los Angeles at the Dolby theatre one name from Hollywood’s recent past will ring out louder than any other: not Cillian or Emma but Ken. There will be 65 of them to be precise, joining Ryan Gosling on stage as he performs I’m Just a Ken from Barbie whose cast has been all over the Oscars’ pastel pink
